III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff asked youth to flash him.
1

Investigation I reviewed intake dated 04/03/2023. It states that on 04/02/2023
at noon Staff Person 1 asked Youth A to flash him while doing
cleaning detail and that she did. Complainant and Probation
Officer has nothing else to add to the allegations.
I reviewed Staff Person 2’s email to the facility’s program
communications personnel. It states allegations of Staff Person 1
asking Youth A to flash him while cleaning the pantry after lunch
on 04/02/2023 came about when one resident informed other
residents which eventually got to staff. Youth A denied the
allegations when asked by staff and made threats toward Youth B.
Youth B reports Youth A informing her of the allegations later in
the day and that she did not observe anything.
I reviewed video surveillance of the kitchen area dated 04/02/2023
with DHHS Worker. Staff Person 1 and Youth A are not observed
together in the kitchen between 10:30am and 2:00pm as the
alleged incident occurred after lunch. Staff Person 1 and Youth A
are observed walking into the kitchen at 07:55am. Staff Person 1
stands outside the pantry door and near an exterior door. Youth A
is observed walking into the pantry at 07:55am and exits in less
than one second with a loaf of bread and the two walk out the
exterior door. Staff Person 1 is observed looking through the
exterior doors window for approximately half the time he stood
there. The other half of the time he appears to be directed toward
the pantry though does not appear to be focused on what is inside
the pantry.
I interviewed Youth A onsite with DHHS Worker on 04/04/2023.
When asked if she knew why she was to be interviewed, Youth A
stated that she knew and that it was a lie regarding Staff Person 1
asking to see her breasts. Youth A denies Staff Person 1 asking
her to expose herself to him and denies exposing herself to him.
Youth A was notably upset and then began talking about the
abuse she endured prior to placement and why nothing was done
about it then. She reports discussing her past with another
unidentified resident approximately one month ago and that she
does not know why Youth B said anything noting that Youth B is
not her friend, though Youth C is. Youth A reports once the
allegations started to spread that she had to speak with
Complainant in which she denied Staff Person 1 asking her to
expose herself.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 onsite with DHHS Worker on
04/04/2023. He was accompanied to the interview by Union
2

Steward. He reports being employed by the facility since 10/2005
with no disciplinary issues and is up to date with training hours.
The allegations were read to Staff Person 1 which he denies as
occurring and denies ever being inappropriate. He reports he and
Youth A entered the kitchen sometime in the morning and that she
walked into the pantry to retrieve some bread to feed the squirrels,
whereas he stood outside the pantry at the door leading to the
outdoors. Staff Person 1 denies Youth A exposing herself to him
and denies asking her to flash him as alleged.
I interviewed Staff Person 3 onsite with DHHS Worker on
04/04/2023. He reports being employed by the facility for 18
years and knows Staff Person 1. He reports never observing
anything inappropriate with Staff Person 1 and notes that he has
good character.
I interviewed Youth B onsite with DHHS Worker on 04/04/2023.
She states she and Youth A are not friends and was surprised that
she approached her. Youth B states she was in the living room
during the middle of the day when Youth A approached her and
told her that Staff Person 1 asked her to flash him in the pantry
around noon on 04/02/2023. Youth B states she informed other
residents of what Youth A disclosed which eventually got to the
supervisors. Youth B states Staff Person 1 is a good person and
that she knows Youth A likes him noting that Youth A has made
comments like “He’s my man” in the past. Youth B states she is
not Youth A’s friend and was confused that she did not disclose
such information to Youth C.
I interviewed Youth C onsite with DHHS Worker on 04/04/2023.
She states being friends with Youth A and that Youth A informed
her of the allegations involving Staff Person 1 the same day it
happened noting that it was either Thursday or Friday. Youth C
then changed her timeframe of events to Sunday, 04/04/2023.
She states Youth A went inside the pantry sometime between
08:30am and 09:00am and that he asked her to flash him and that
she complied while inside the pantry. Youth C states Youth A has
previously stated to her that she “wants to (expletive) Staff Person
1”. When asked if Youth C had knowledge of Staff Person 1 ever
being inappropriate with anyone else Youth C appeared to
become excited. Youth C stated that a former unidentified youth
informed another youth that Staff Person 1 was inappropriate but
did not know how. When asked if Staff Person 1 had been
inappropriate with her she repeatedly said, “I don’t know” and
“This is weird” and appeared excited about the question. Youth C
goes on to state that Staff Person 1 asked her one time if her
3

sister was shaped like her, as well as stating, “Eating pineapple
makes my nuts sweet”.
DHHS Worker reports no findings.
Analysis There is no conclusive evidence to substantiate the allegations of
Staff Person 1 asking Youth A to flash him in the pantry. Youth A
denies that the alleged incident occurred and states it is a lie.
Initial reports from Youth B and indicate the alleged incident
occurred after lunchtime on 04/04/2023. Review of video
surveillance does not show Staff Person 1 and Youth A in the
kitchen between 10:30am and 2:00pm. Youth C reports being
informed by Youth A that the alleged incident occurred between
08:30am and 09:00am on 03/30 or 03/31/2023 then changed her
timeframe to 04/02/2023. Video surveillance shows Staff Person
1 and Youth A walk into the kitchen at 07:55am. Staff Person 1
stands outside the pantry door and near an exterior door. Youth A
is observed walking into the pantry at 07:55am and exits at
07:56am with a loaf of bread and the two walk out the exterior
door. Staff Person 1 is observed looking through the exterior
doors window for approximately half the time he stood there. The
other half of the time he appears to be directed toward the pantry
though does not appear to be focused on what is inside the
pantry.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
